snippet: In response to the attacks on Sept. 11, New York City now has a sturdy legion of undercover officers who have taken up residence in many surprising regions of civic life.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column notes that city now has legion of undercover officers taking placed in surprising regions of civic life, much of which began in 2003 when federal judge lifted restraints on spying by Police Department; questions why city felt compelled to deploy undercover detective to spy on Occupy Sandy, relief operation run by activists delivering food and supplies to parts of city ruined by the storm.
lead_paragraph: In response to the attacks on Sept. 11, New York City now has a sturdy legion of undercover officers who have taken up residence in many surprising regions of civic life.
